definition: to make way (for sth)
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: No problem is permanent storms always give way to the sun.
sentences.chinese: 风暴总会给阳光让路，寒冬总会转变为暖春。

sentences.english: If the car does not yield to pedestrian, the car could be ticketed.
sentences.chinese: 大多数国家，如果车子不给行人让路，会被抄罚单的。

sentences.english: Power -driven heavier - than -air aircraft shall give way to gliders.
sentences.chinese: 重于空气的动力驱动飞机应该给滑翔机让路。

sentences.english: Your project will have to make way, for the main project.
sentences.chinese: 你们的工程得给重点工程让路。

sentences.english: A fat sow was grubbing about near the gate and refused to move out of our way.
sentences.chinese: 一只肥母猪在大门口拱来拱去，不肯给我们让路。

sentences.english: I will never make way for a fool.
sentences.chinese: 我从来不会给一个傻瓜让路。

sentences.english: When entering a trail or starting a descent, yield to other skiers.
sentences.chinese: 进入滑雪道或开始下滑时，要给其他滑雪者让路。

sentences.english: Make way, oh, make way for my Eastern Rose.
sentences.chinese: 让路，哦，请为我美丽的东方玫瑰让点路。

sentences.english: Aeroplanes shall give way to power -driven heavier - than -air aircraft.
sentences.chinese: 飞机应该给重于空气的动力驱动飞机让路。

sentences.english: Cars have to yield to pedestrians at zebra crossings.
sentences.chinese: 汽车须在斑马线前停下来让路予行人。

sentences.english: We did not give way to bitterness.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有给苦难和怨恨让路。

sentences.english: Anti-terrorism gave way to its much more potent cousin, anti-insurgency.
sentences.chinese: 反恐让路给了其更有力的表亲，平叛。

sentences.english: An optimization opportunity model is proposed for given-way vessel to take collision avoidance action.
sentences.chinese: 应用多种理论方法建立了让路船避碰时机优化模型。

sentences.english: Storms always give away to the sun. Winner always thaws into springtime.
sentences.chinese: 风暴总会给阳光让路，寒冬总会转变为暖春。

sentences.english: Matteo Brighi might make way for Simone Perrotta in a more attacking formation.
sentences.chinese: 布里吉可能需要给佩罗塔让路，使阵容更具攻击性。

sentences.english: The tears are not just giving ways to joy, they produce joy.
sentences.chinese: 所以，泪水不仅为喜乐让路，而且它们将生发出喜乐。

definition: to get out of the way/to step aside
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to abdicate/to yield
to open up a path/to make one's way through/to construct a road/(electricity) open circuit
to clear the way
to stop/to obstruct
to make a detour/to take the long route
to let pass
to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
to get out of the way
to look for trouble
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
to meet/to welcome/to greet
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
to bring up the rear/to provide support/to hold the lines
